message: what kind of "directive" languages are supported?
what endpoints can we currently "talk" to ?
There are webhooks (useful for building interfaces to all sorts of other endpoints, like sprinkler systems, missile launchers, and bird feeders)
sprinkler systems, missile launchers, and bird feeders talk http ?
Ok. In the meantime are there any devices that talk http / javascript that have been tested on KNS ?
Anything that can feed input to a computer could potentially talk HTTP; it's just a matter of implementing it.
I recently stumbled on some java sunspots and sentilla perks I acquired long time ago....I think they would love to join KNS...
Jessie Morris programmed an Arduino to talk to KNS once. Made a light flash when he got a Twitter mention or something.
From @TelegramSam : @rsbohn and I are working on a Kynetx/Arduino powered sprinkler controller
I'm interested to see how it turns out.
My Arduino code expects simple text directives: "LM 04" to launch missile #4.

Currently, KNS can either return executable javascript or a JSON based directive document. Additional formats are supported through the webhooks endpoint, where directive documents can be turned into html, plain text, javascript (not the same as the engine returns...), etc.
I have one VM that boots and then pulls instructions (a script) from KNS using the webhooks endpoint.
